about.name: Kyle Nahrgang
about.title: Software Technologist
about.about: I am a seasoned software technologist with extensive experience in designing, implementing, and documenting architectural solutions that require cross-team collaboration. My career includes a strong focus on technical engineering, where I have developed a passion for creating robust software solutions. I have a proven track record of building highly functional teams that deliver complex features, backed by a deep understanding of embedded software design and a commitment to engineering excellence.

data.title: FULL-STACK BILLIARD LEAGUE HANDICAP PREDICTION APP
bullets: Reverse-engineered GraphQL API to scrape league data
Docker container running nginx hosted by GCP cloud-run instance
Custom machine learning models for handicap prediction using Rust (burn)

responsibility: Spent 100% of time using C to implement bug fixes and improvements to SQLXpress, an interface for the SQL subsystem on HPE NonStop
Improved Makefile build system
Created custom VS-Code extension using TypeScript to remotely debug C/C++ applications on HPE NonStop host
Developed proof-of-concept conversion of legacy Makefile build system to modern CMake implementation
Identified and recommended 5 changes to modernize legacy codebase

Spent 10 months as one of two software architects for product engineering organization of 200 engineers designing several facets of ADT’s “Trusted Neighbor” feature set reporting to the Director of Product Architecture

As a software architect, spent 50% of time converting requirements into holistic architectural solutions that spanned from C++ edge device firmware, through Java SpringBoot and GCP hosted backend, and to mobile and web UIs
As a software architect, spent 25% of time communicating solutions to cross functional teams consisting of all levels of engineer, from junior developers to the VP of Engineering
As a software architect, spent 25% of time working with C-suite to find and present solutions to high-visibility issues and feature requests
Implemented processes to streamline architectural intake, solution review, and output

Spent 3 years as Lead Engineer for Firmware Development team of 10 engineers reporting to the Director of Firmware Engineering developing embedded C++ business logic deployed to tens of thousands of Base devices
As Lead Engineer, I spent 30% of time writing and reviewing modern C++ and Rust
As Lead Engineer, I spent 30% of time mentoring more junior developers and fostering strong engineering principles
As Lead Engineer, I spent 40% of time establishing priorities and coordinating development efforts across between firmware, backend, and UI development teams

Oversaw full product lifecycle of ADT’s Base device including writing the first lines of C++ business logic code through first article inspection for mass manufacturing at the manufacturing facility in Vietnam
Re-wrote legacy business logic application using modern C++ techniques (C++17) resulting in a 60% reduction in lines of code and 95% unit test code coverage
Oversaw development of and integration with wireless devices and sensors using ULE and Z-Wave radios
Ensured that the security system business logic conformed to security industry standards, primarily SIA PC-01
Acted as primary maintainer of ARM based embedded linux distribution generated using Buildroot
Established a culture of engineering excellence that focused on rigor and best practice to deliver high reliable code where under 5% of bug reports were regressions
Implemented and maintained GCP build pipelines that generated and deployed build artifacts to tens of thousands of Base devices
Established automated pipelines to ensure all unit tests passed, code coverage exceeded 95%, and that code was formatted and documented before any code could be merged
Designed and implemented encrypted firmware upgrade system
Supported production issues leveraging custom logging in Dynatrace and Splunk
Implemented Secure Boot
Developed embedded encryption tools for ARM using OP-TEE
Built a firmware recovery platform using Python Django
Participated in third-party penetration testing which found no vulnerabilities
Debug and modify Linux kernel drivers for I2S audio, WiFi, and others
Developed proof-of-concept board support package (BSP) for ARM based device using Yocto
Consistently awarded highest performance ratings
Led a team of 3 senior-level engineers developing embedded application for credit card terminals to meet industry standards (EMV, ISO-8583, PCI-DSS)
Acted as lead developer for embedded payment application installed on over 100k credit card terminals
Spent 50% of time working with stakeholders to interpret requirements and schedule development
Spent 50% of time writing C++ (C++11) to resolve bugs and implement new features
Organized and led the rewrite of a legacy C/C++ payment application to use modern C++ techniques resulting in a 70% reduction in lines of code
Interfaced with customers to interpret feature requests into technical requirements
Acted as subject matter expert for EMV and ISO-8583 domain knowledge

Fully automated device and application certification testing, including building a Python based UI and an OpenBuilds based robot driven by a Java Spring Boot application which resulting in $30k/mo savings
Established rules and best practices for development, test, and deployment processes
Implemented and maintained build and deployment pipelines using Jenkins, GoCD, and BitBucket
Attended industry conferences and reported on changing standards
Consistently awarded highest performance ratings
Led development team of 5 to 10 engineers writing network monitoring applications for linux and windows to assist in Unisys Stealth
configuration utility
As team lead, I spent 50% of my time writing C/C++ and 50% managing requirements and delivery schedules
Acted as Scrum Master for team of 5 to 10 engineers in development team of 15 teams and 140 engineers working on the Unisys s-Par Hypervisor
As Scrum Master, I spent 80% of my time writing code to deliver features, and 20% of my time communicating priorities and planning delivery
schedules
Developed high-speed interconnect between hypervisor instances using Infiniband
Developed virtual network (vNIC) device drivers for Linux and Windows to communicate between virtual machines running on Unisys s-Par
Maintained Buildroot build system which generated several Linux images that comprised the Unisys s-Par hypervisor
Acted as subject matter expert for Command subsystem of Unisys s-Par, written in C#
Wrote C to contribute to the Control subsystem of Unisys s-Par
Promoted from Associate Software Engineer to Senior Software Engineer within 3 years
Consistently awarded highest performance ratings

data.title: Establishing trust between applications in a computing environment
data.subtitle: Application US17/885,236
data.description: A method, system and device are disclosed. A premises device comprising a first operating system and a second operating system is described. The premises device comprises processing circuitry configured to establish a chain of trust at least between the first operating system and at least one software application associated with the second operating system. The processing circuitry is further configured to perform at least one action based at least in part on the established chain of trust.

data.title: Network provisioning and tokenization using a remote terminal
data.subtitle: US-12047356
data.description: A method of tokenizing sensitive data from a terminal device includes receiving, a connection request comprising a hardware serial number associated with a terminal device and validating the hardware serial number associated with the terminal device. The method includes sending a command to a terminal device that causes the terminal device to display a prompt for sensitive data associated with a user interacting with the terminal device and receiving an encrypted data packet from the terminal device. The encrypted data packet includes the sensitive data. The method includes sending the encrypted data packet to a gateway system for tokenization, receiving a token that represents the sensitive data, and providing the token to the terminal device.

data.title: Nonstop Computing Fabric Arrangements
data.subtitle: US-10965616
data.description: Systems and methods for non-stop computing in a virtualization fabric are disclosed. One system includes a computing fabric comprising a plurality of host platforms, the plurality of host platforms including at least a first host platform and a second host platform communicatively connected to the first host platform. The system also includes an interconnect service partitions residing on the first host platform. The system includes a plurality of guest partitions distributed across the plurality of host platforms. The system further includes a DNS server instance managed by at least one of the plurality of interconnect service partitions and defining at least one zone, the at least one zone including one or more partitions from among the plurality of guest partitions distributed across the plurality of host plat forms.

data.title: System and method of constructing a memory-based interconnect between multiple partitions
data.subtitle: Application US13/955,188
data.description: The shared memory interconnect system provides an improved method for efficiently and dynamically sharing resources between two or more guest partitions. The system also provides a method to amend the parameters of the shared resources without resetting all guest partitions. In various embodiments, a XML file is used to dynamically define the parameters of shared resources. In one such embodiment using a XML or equivalent file, the interconnect system driver will establish a mailbox shared by each guest partition. The mailbox provides messaging queues and related structures between the guest partitions. In various embodiments, the interconnect system driver may use macros to locate each memory structure. The shared memory interconnect system allows a virtualization system to establish the parameters of shared resources during runtime.
